charging.lead: Charge your electric vehicle while working, shopping, or going out! There's no need to keep thinking about how much battery is left.

contact.title: Let's connect!
contact.lead: Feel free to send us a message or check out our social media. We're happy to chat!
contact.errorFail: Something went wrong, please try again

contactPopup.title: Thank you!
contactPopup.lead: Our team will come back to you as soon as possible. Thank you for your message.

energy.lead: All of this infrastructure is supported by renewable energy sources and strives to be carbon negative.

mobility.lead: Pick the best mode of transport for you. A car, a bicycle, a bus, or even a short walk. We try to make it as convenient as possible.

ev-stats.head: EV Charging Stats
ev-stats.subtitle: Gaia Green Tech presents
ev-stats.title: EV Charging Statistics
ev-stats.note-content1: all data and charts presented here are available under
ev-stats.note-content2: license. You are free to share and adapt them to your needs as long as you attribute Gaia Green Tech as the source. Feel free to link to this website and/or mention our Facebook/Instagram/Twitter pages.

ev-faq.head: EV FAQ
ev-faq.subtitle: Gaia Green Tech answers
ev-faq.lead: In our daily interactions with people interested in EVs, we receive a lot of questions. We decided to compile the answers into a neat, visual flyer for everyone.

footnotes.title: Footnotes
footnotes.2a: According to a CAWI study, the average daily trip by car in the EU is about 20km
footnotes.2b: Assuming the 250km range, you would need to charge it about every 2 weeks
footnotes.2c: Of course this depends on your situation but on average trips over 300km are very rare
footnotes.2d: 40% of drivers only do one or two trips over 300km a year, and just 20% do it three or more times
footnotes.3a: Note that the charge is usually done when you're not using the car anyway
footnotes.3b: I.e. it’s parked for the night, you’re out shopping or you stopped on a trip to use the restrooms and have a break with a meal or coffee
footnotes.3c: At no point you should wait for the car to charge
footnotes.9a: EVs are also cheaper to maintain. Over 5 years of ownership, Nissan Leaf is over 500€ cheaper to maintain and service than a VW Golf
footnotes.9b: After that period of time, the cost to maintain an EV remains the same while the petrol and diesel costs grow rapidly

ev-faq.petrol-price: Assuming an average price of {price}€ per litre
ev-faq.diesel-price: Assuming an average price of {price}€ per litre
ev-faq.electricity-price: Assuming an average price of {price}€ per kWh
ev-faq.discounted-electricity-price: Assuming an average price of {price}€ per kWh when charging during the night with an EV specific tariff
